title: Fake News: Young Men Did NOT Rent Yacht, It Did NOT Sink By Excess Of Prostitutes | Lead Stories
subtitle: Did a yacht in Miami sink because the friends who rented it for a bachelor party invited too many prostitutes...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Did a yacht in Miami sink because the friends who rented it for a bachelor party invited too many prostitutes on board? No, that's not true: the story came from a satirical website, it did not happen for real.

The story appeared in an article published by There Is News on June 17, 2018 titled "Young men rent a yacht and it sinks by excess of prostitutes" (archived here) which opened:

The story was just a translation of the original Spanish version of the story, which was set in Valencia:

And the picture of the sinking boat was just a stock photo:

The site There Is News carries a "Legal Warging" (archived here) that reads:

The site "There is news" (http://thereisnews.es) (hereinafter referred to as TIN) is a humor site whose purpose is entertainment. The content of TIN is fiction and does not correspond to reality. All references, names, brands or institutions that appear on the site are used as contextual elements, as in any novel or fiction account.

The site is the English language version of the Spanish satire site Hay Noticia, which is owned by Spanish humor website/collective La Fabrica de la Comedia S.C.

We wrote about thereisnews.com before, here are our most recent articles that mention the site:

• Fake News: Nightclub DJ NOT Beaten Up After Playing 'Despacito' For The Tenth Time
• Fake News: Man Did NOT Skip Police Control Because He Thought They Were Filming 'Star Wars'
• Fake News: Pope Francis Did NOT Cancel The Bible, Did NOT Propose To Create New Book
